bug.short_desc: No way to launch SubDownloader from the MATE panel
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: I was delighted to see an update for SubDownloader today, thanks for that :) But on Fedora 25 amd64 with the MATE Desktop version 1.16.1, it's impossible to launch the subdownloader application from the Applications > Sound & Video > SubDownloader menu. This returns an error window with "Failed to change to directory '/usr/share/subdownloader' (No such file or directory)". Starting it with simply subdownloader from the command line works fine though.
So I had the idea of editing the /usr/share/applications/subdownloader.desktop file and commenting out "Path=/usr/share/subdownloader" with a # and the program started just fine. I'm reporting this so it can be useful for others.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 2.0.19-1.fc25
How reproducible: Always.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Click on Applications on the main top MATE panel 2. Then choose Sound & Video and then SubDownloader
fixed , thanks , tomorrow should arrive to updates testing
